reviewText: This is a somewhat typical romantic comedy of the type where the two protagonists spend the movie as antagonists until they realize they actually like each other. The twist on this one is that there isn't really much fighting. In the story, the main character has inherited a house in the California wine country from a friend who passed away and he is making it into a bed and breakfast. It turns out the friend was originally Brazilian and when her son also passes away, the grandaughter who still lives in Brazil inherits the house too. Each of the main characters has a sad family story. He was married to an actress who dumped him and the girl has a brother who is always in trouble. The girl, of course, heads to California to try to sell the house. At first she keeps her identity secret but eventually the guy finds out and a brief period of wrangling over the house takes place. Both of the main characters seems like genuinely nice people and they really aren't capable of hating each other too deeply or for too long. This is actually a nice change of pace for this type of movie because it results in some nice scenes with a lot of heart. This movie is similar in production quality to a made for TV movie so it lacks a bit of Hollywood glitz but it is pleasant to watch. There are some things that are a bit of a stretch. The Brazil aspect seems a bit contrived almost as if it were cooked up to create a back story for the actress who was chosen, and some of the "legal" aspects of the house ownership seem a bit of a stretch, but in spite of a few things like that, it is still very watchable. The characters are very attractive and play very likable people in the movie. This movie won't become a classic, but it is worth checking out.
Title: Bed & Breakfast

reviewText: Hard to forget Dean Cain's original claim to fame, but this time he is a much more realistic and whole person.  His character does very well against bad odds.  The tiny town's odd ways make it hard to keep up when high-powered foreign lawyer comes to help a friend take away his dream.  All characters are good.  The initial portion where scenes take place in Brazil are hard to follow because of the speed of conversation.  Had not found setting for subtitles when we watched it.  Very enjoyable in a Hallmark movie kind of way.  Might watch again some time.
Title: Bed & Breakfast

reviewText: Dean Cain brightens up anything he's in, but he couldn't save this poorly written mess.There was an idea here with some potential. However, evidently the writer was a 10 year old who has never been out of the house. Virtually no one's actions in the film ring true.This movie is meant to be an antithetical romance (boy and girl start out with major conflict, but get together anyway) but doesn't really sell that in the story, nor does the story provide any compelling reason (outside of boy seeing girl sunbath in a bikini) to really indicate what drew them together.There is a lot of law involved through the middle of the film, and none of it is even CLOSE to being right. A half hour worth of research could have saved all that embarrassment. For example, our heroine finds out that her father has died and supposedly she is responsible for all his debts. Unless she co-signed some loans, that isn't true. There isn't even any way to stretch that to make it plausible.Situations that the writer and director hoped would be zany and funny are just contrived and awkward.Characters who are meant to be funny caricatures are just annoying. Bill Engvall is completely wasted. Eric Roberts is tragically miscast as a gay hotel reviewer. Juliana Paes seems uncomfortable in most of her scenes. Julia Duffy is underused.This film is a waste of everyone's time. The only thing that saves this from one star is that most of the actors did try. They just had nothing to work with.
Title: Bed & Breakfast

They're Brazilian, and they're speaking Portuguese.  One of the jokes in the movie is where the Hispanic maid catches out the lawyer who claims to be Spanish.  He can't understand a word she's saying.Dean Cain is cute as a button but somehow it just isn't enough.

reviewText: This is a different kind of romantic movie in that it has a number of scenes in Brazil early in the movie but then moves to the United States. There are extended sections in Portuguese and later in English but sub-titles are provided for the Portuguese sections which move by very quickly; we discovered we had to pause the movie in order to read the English translations.The movie is adequately paced and has some lovely scenery in both Brazil and later in California. The acting is satisfactory and the characters are of sufficient interest that one begins to care what happens to them.This is a chick-flick with a South American twist that is generally entertaining and fun to watch.

reviewText: Not a bad movie; we watched it because we lead a group that watches movies about California, mostly history but sometimes fiction, and thought this could be interesting.  It's geographically incorrect -- supposedly in Webster, CA near Temecula, which are in opposite parts of the state, and one gets the feeling they're trying to make you think it's Napa.  Not that that really matters.  Better than watching something really evil or a horror movie, but we kinda regret spending our time on it.

reviewText: Great actors -- Dean Cain always does a great job.  But the background for the story was just horrible... Saying that the daughter inherited $500k debt from her father's death is just silly.  Saying that the grandma's holographic will wasn't sufficient to transfer the property was wrong.  Saying that if you pay the taxes on a property it is yours to keep is also flawed.  They really could have done a great job with the movie and story line if they had just researched it a little better.

reviewText: 'Bed and Breakfast' has Dean Cain doing what he does so well- showing off his boyish smile and nice guy personality!  This is a quality romantic comedy with all the usual elements.  Of course, it's predictable; they all are.  If you want a fun romance with a bit of conflict between the love interests, quirky but likeable characters, beautiful scenery and a happy ending, here you go.Dean's character is fixing up a huge home that he inherited from a friend.  His dream is to open a B&B.;  He's married and still longs for his good-for-nothing and unfaithful movie star actress/wife who left him high and dry and is now filing for divorce.Now in Brazil, of all places, a sales supervisor(Paes) struggles to support her worthless brother, put up with a fun loving, self-center fiance, and try to keep her job.  She suddenly finds herself loaded with a huge debt now left by here recently deceased father.  Her friend and lawyer discovers she does have a deed to a property in the US left to her by a grandmother she never met.Of course, this is the same place that Dean believes he owns, thus the catch in the story, where all the tension and fun begins, once she arrives to lay claim to what may be hers.  He's not about to give up without a fight.The side characters including John Savage as a grumpy customer, and Eric Roberts as an apparent uptight, fastidious boarder are amusing, but the entertainment is between the leads as any good RC should be.As noted by other reviewers, they need larger subtitles.  There's not a great deal, but we had to pause to read some of them.  Once she's in the States, they pretty much speak English.  The filming and editing are well done; there's implied sexuality(with some funny, amorous newlywed Japenese) but none shown, other than some kissing; no real language; no bad people.It's lightweight fare like it should be, and we enjoyed it.  Give us more!
summary: Dean Cain at His Romantic Best
Title: Bed & Breakfast

reviewText: Wonderful Love Story in the Fields of Grape Vines of this California Wine Country "Bed and Breakfast" movie of how a young man is divorcing his cheating wife and opens the large home into  a Bed and Breakfast in California's Wine Country and a couple show up to add to his problems of opening on time for the Wine Festival which he has is heart on making his business the talk of the Wine Critics Reviews.  What a cast of Dean Cain plays Jake, Juliana Paes is Ana the Supervisor of a department store in Brazil who finds she is in debt from losing her father to a heart attack and that her fathers mother had left her a home in California.  Bill Engvall is Jake's Brother Pete Sullivan who is a Sheriff in the town of Webster, California Wine Country.  Julian Stone who plays Victor is Ana's Lawyer who goes with her to take over the house her grandmother left her as the only living heir of the family.  This way she can pay off her father's $500,000 debt and move on with her life.  John Savage is a guest at the Bed and Breakfast called Mr. Harvey and his wife is Julia Duffy who plays Mrs. Harvey, with Eric Roberts popping up as the Wine Critic who is there to review the areas Bed and Breakfast and Wine he is known as a tough critic Mr. Hopewell and the Love Story is a wonderful way to spend a Friday or Saturday night at home with your husband or boyfriend or vise a verse wife or girlfriend................Here is the link to the movie "Bed and Breakfast" :http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0084HABEQ/ref=wtls_list_pr_10
summary: Love is in the Grape Vines of this Movie "Bed and Breakfast" for sure...

reviewText: It's not that Bed and Breakfast is a bad movie.  The formula is simply an overused one.  Jake (Dean Cain) is a handyman who was left a dilapidated home in California's wine country.  Slowly, he fixes up the place to get it ready to be a respectable bed and breakfast inn.  But then he finds out that another person, Ana (Juliana Paes), in Brazil no less, is claiming ownership.  Ana decides to sneak a visit to California, they meet, get mad at each other, and then...Well, what do you expect?Here are a couple of interesting plot problems.  Jake and his bother are always commenting about getting and drinking a beer.  You may notice that these "beers" are O'Douls, a non-alcoholic brew.  And Ana suddenly becomes a cook extraordinaire, even though there is not a hint at this talent earlier in the movie.It's a fun movie, as long as you temper your expectations.
Title: Bed & Breakfast
